cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then aiming toward the southeastern U.S. coast (most likely the North-South Carolina coastline) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North or South Carolina

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from Georgia northward to Virginia, with greatest risk from South Carolina through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤ 11%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late in the 5-day period; otherwise breezy with higher surf.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia barrier islands due to long-period swell.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered squalls and brief heavy showers possible Thursday–Friday; totals generally 1–3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning early week and persisting through the storm’s passage.
